exercises.name: Leg Swings (Front/Back & Side)
exercises.note: CUE: Tall posture, swing free. Dynamically stretches hip flexors and hamstrings to prevent stiffness in cold weather.

exercises.name: Hip Circles (Standing Hip CARs)
exercises.note: CUE: Draw big circle with knee, stable torso. Warms the joint through its full range and identifies 'stuck' areas before mounting.

exercises.name: Walking Lunges + Twist
exercises.note: CUE: Big step, drop hips, twist toward front knee. Mobilizes the spine to better follow the horse's motion.

exercises.name: Lateral Lunges
exercises.note: CUE: Side stretch inner thigh. thinking about opening the hip angle.

exercises.name: Open/Close the Gate
exercises.note: CUE: Lift knee, open hip. Mimics mounting and preps the motion of clearing the saddle.

exercises.name: Arm Circles & Trunk Rotations
exercises.note: CUE: Loosen shoulders. Relaxed shoulders allow for clearer, softer rein aids.

exercises.name: COOL: Hip Flexor Stretch
exercises.note: POST-RIDE: Hold 30s. Tuck tailbone to prevent that 'locked hips' feeling.

exercises.name: COOL: Adductor Stretch
exercises.note: POST-RIDE: Hold 30s. Think opening the hip angle. Improves your ability to maintain a long, secure leg.

exercises.name: COOL: Figure-4 Glute Stretch
exercises.note: POST-RIDE: Targets deep hip rotators that get tight from sitting trot.

exercises.name: COOL: Calf Stretch
exercises.note: POST-RIDE: Ensures ankles don't stiffen after heels-down position.

exercises.name: COOL: Chest Opener
exercises.note: POST-RIDE: Doorway stretch. Counteracts rounding after a long day in the saddle.

exercises.name: COOL: Cat-Camel Release
exercises.note: POST-RIDE: Segmental motion. Loosens the back after stabilizing during your ride.

exercises.name: Goblet Squat
exercises.note: CUE: Weight in heels. Improves shock absorption when landing jumps.

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift (RDL)
exercises.note: CUE: Hip-hinge. Strengthens glutes/hamstrings to protect the back.

exercises.name: Lateral Lunge
exercises.note: CUE: Depth symmetry. Targets inner thigh strength for secure legs.

exercises.name: Copenhagen Plank (Bent-Knee)
exercises.note: CUE: Squeeze inner thighs. Increases groin resilience for stability.

exercises.name: Back Extension (Supermans)
exercises.note: CUE: Neutral spine. Helps maintain posture when the horse pulls.

exercises.name: Bird-Dog
exercises.note: CUE: No hip tilt. Builds deep core for an independent seat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell One-arm Row
exercises.note: CUE: Squeeze blade. Combats rounded shoulders for better posture.

exercises.name: Incline Push-ups
exercises.note: CUE: Bench hands. Supports upper body stability and balance.

exercises.name: 90/90 Hip Stretch & Activation
exercises.note: CUE: Lift back foot. Increases hip mobility for a deeper seat.

exercises.name: Ankle Dorsiflexion Rocks
exercises.note: CUE: Knee to wall. Vital for heels-down shock absorption.

exercises.name: Trap Bar / KB Deadlift
exercises.note: CUE: Drive heels. Power to sit deeper without compromising posture.

exercises.name: Reverse Lunge
exercises.note: CUE: Controlled descent. Evens out left-right aids and mounting strength.

exercises.name: Copenhagen Plank (Hold)
exercises.note: CUE: Top leg support. Maintains long leg without slipping.

exercises.name: Swiss Ball Hamstring Curls
exercises.note: CUE: Lift hips. Mimics using legs while stabilizing the core.

exercises.name: Plank with Shoulder Taps
exercises.note: CUE: Hips level. Anti-rotation for a more centered saddle position.

exercises.name: Face Pulls
exercises.note: CUE: Rear shoulders. Improves stability for rein control.

exercises.name: Back / Front Squat
exercises.note: CUE: Heavier load. Solidifies core to keep position against powerful motion.

exercises.name: Single-Leg RDL
exercises.note: CUE: Hips level. Iron out asymmetries and challenge stirrup balance.

exercises.name: Copenhagen Plank (Motion)
exercises.note: CUE: Hip dips. Adds concentric work for a secure seat connection.

exercises.name: Box / Squat Jumps
exercises.note: CUE: Soft landing. Trains quick balance adjustments after fences.

exercises.name: Stirrup Stand Plank
exercises.note: CUE: Unstable surface. Required for endurance in the two-point.

exercises.name: Bent-Over Reverse Fly
exercises.note: CUE: Mid-back squeeze. Strengthens muscles for a stiller upper body.

exercises.name: Barbell Deadlift
exercises.note: CUE: Neutral spine. Peak hip extensor strength for a stable seat.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squat
exercises.note: CUE: Control down. Unilateral strength and dynamic hip stretch.

exercises.name: Skater Hops (Lateral Bound)
exercises.note: CUE: Lateral hip power. Helpful for sticking tight turns.

exercises.name: Copenhagen Plank (Adv. Hold)
exercises.note: CUE: Straight leg. Toned inner thighs that stabilize subtly.

exercises.name: Pallof Press
exercises.note: CUE: Anti-rotation. Resists forces that twist your torso in the saddle.

exercises.name: Seated Cable Row
exercises.note: CUE: Independent hands. Back muscles stabilize for better rein control.

exercises.name: DB Bench Press
exercises.note: CUE: Shoulder stability. Adds pushing strength for general conditioning.

exercises.name: Front Squat / Split Jumps
exercises.note: CUE: Explosive up. Solidifies the coordination needed for quick stabilization.

exercises.name: KB Swings / Power Clean
exercises.note: CUE: Hip drive. Transferable to the 'closing and opening' hip angle of jumping.

exercises.name: Depth Drops
exercises.note: CUE: Absorb impact. Trains mechanics for stability upon landing jumps.

exercises.name: Copenhagen (Maintenance)
exercises.note: CUE: Snug contact. Maintains formidable inner thigh endurance.

exercises.name: Turkish Get-Up
exercises.note: CUE: Smooth and braced. Integrates core, shoulder, and hip stability.

exercises.name: Farmers Carry
exercises.note: CUE: Heavy weight. Trains the core to stabilize under asymmetric barn loads.

exercises.name: Stirrup Stand Balance
exercises.note: CUE: Unstable stance. Mimics the two-point position on stirrups.

exercises.name: 2-Point Intervals Off-Horse
exercises.note: CUE: 30s hold. Mimics the heart-rate spike of a jump-off course.

exercises.name: Med Ball Slam & Rotational Toss
exercises.note: CUE: Powerful snap. Trains the body to regain balance after a half-halt.

exercises.name: Bounding / Agility Ladder
exercises.note: CUE: Quick feet. Improves coordination for better reaction time in the saddle.

exercises.name: Pull-ups
exercises.note: CUE: Shoulder health. Supports a following, steady hand without bracing.

exercises.name: Push-ups
exercises.note: CUE: Stiller upper body. Ensures overall conditioning for the barn athlete.
